title: 'Rare' pick for Jungle/Support?
body:
Hey there, Master Fledgling here.

So. On my apparently perpetual quest for a champion to main and a main to champion (Yes, that makes sense both directions -- English Major) I have boiled down a few things to certainties:

1 - I main the Jungle and Support
2 - I like tanks or champions with MAD escape skills
3 - ~~I am a hipster~~ I like champions that are rarely picked so I can main them uninterrupted

From all this, names like Galio, Yorick and Zac all come to mind, though that middle one is getting a hefty rebuild, apparently.

Not exactly sure what I am in need of help with, but perhaps I would like some info on how these champions operate and if they would be feasible in the positions of support and jungle.

Many thanks and may your cup spillith over,

-MF

replies.body:
Try Skarner jungle.
I used to play Maokai support once in a while. Keep the saplings at level one. Just use them as ward relief if you're out of wards and have to stay.
Use Runes and Masteries for a ton of armor and build relic shield. You can get away with leaping on their adc quite often and just healing it back with shield and passive. The initiate is pretty strong and zones them well. The ult and passive both work nice in bot-lane.

You pretty much mimic Leona and perform a lot like her. But, you're a tree.
Or you could max saplings first and take away a third of their hp, go W them at the sapling land site, and your ADC can finish them off no problem.
Sejuani jungle

~~IM HIPSTER TOO~~

Hahahaha I like to play rare champs, or not common champs to generaly surprise others and this is an advantage for me.
For example:
-I enjoy {{champion:3}} support and mid
-{{champion:53}}  Jungle makes great ganks
-And generally not so common champs: {{champion:133}} {{champion:83}} {{champion:112}}
I like jungle Malzahar - it's the unexpected pick that I actually typically do quite well with.  Lulu is a strong support who isn't being used much nowadays.

That because lulu is stronger as a solo laner then she is as a support. I wish you guys can fix that and bring more strength to her support role. Since the beginning of season 4 all you guys did was nerf her so she can be a balance solo laner which lead to weakening support lulu strength and with no buff compensation to her support role that stattik said he will do.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J36ccUR-eqc

Great example :D
:O I play him AP

Honestly, I get flamed every time I decide I feel like playing it. 
Then I carry the team with the most CS as the jungler and enough kills to make an Akali gawk.

Jungle Malz OP yo.

I like Mundo support alot, he's the most "unconventional" that i've played.

* Max Q first

* Build FotM and sightone, the rest is the usual mundo build

* I go with  masteries; 0/26/4 for utility i take the MS and Scout

* For Runes same as top Mundo

> I like Mundo support alot, he's the most "unconventional" that i've played.
> 
> * Max Q first
> 
> * Build FotM and sightone, the rest is the usual mundo build
> 
> * I go with  masteries; 0/26/4 for utility i take the MS and Scout
> 
> * For Runes same as top Mundo

Yeah, Mundo Support is surprisingly strong! Those 3 second cleavers hurt, man.

I have played {{champion:3}} support with great success, but I found him lacking in jungle. His clear is slow and he requires assists to even keep up. Once you fall behind, it is nearly impossible to close up again.

Whith the new jungle it's anyone's guess what will work, but clears seem to be more difficult.

One of my favourites is {{champion:12}} , he is also somewhat slow in jungle, but still fast enough and his ganks are crazy. He can do a game 5/0/15 with nothing more than boots of swiftness and is not picked too often either.

{{champion:111}} is very rarely picked, but known to work in both positions, though he is deemed not the greatest support.

{{champion:53}} is a weird jungler, he can *literally* steal the enemy buffs, but he is too popular as support.

{{champion:78}} is still rarely picked, but should work rreally well in both positions

Blitz the fisherman jungler XD
I got Blitz so long ago and I only started trying to get good with him now that I can manage mana better now.
Too bad you can't grab Baron and pull him out of the pit anymore :I
remember when you could pull dragon over the wall? blitz dragon steals are best steals

LOL
Level one first bloods when he grabs an unsuspecting jungler waiting for the camp to spawn.
OR! Syndra starts with her orb grab, and grabs the buff. IDK if she has enough range to grab it from over the wall or not.
darious has enough range why wouldn't syndra?
i have smart cast on, so i never really know what the range is on half of my abilities XD

Zac is a super hard support to play because his abilities are very dive centric like leona, but he doesn't get the extra Resistances and his CC is all skill shots and kind of telegraphed. I've seen it work once, but that is the only time I've EVER seen it. 

I'm not a galio player so i really can't give any positive input here, but i've seen people play him in both successfully.

I'd also look at Leona, but I'm not sure how successful as a jungler, but I've heard it can be successful. She is a clear support pick and can work well.

While he has fallen out of favor you could try naut. He is naturally a jungler, but he can and has been a very tanky support.

Those are the top ones that I've seen go over decent as both a jungler and support. Its not limited to those, but you could look at them.

Zac is probably better top/jungle then support
I love Zac he is so much fun, though I am not very good with him sadly

I like Zac as well, but I think meta picks made him fade out :I
Nautilus would be a good pick to go with, I've seen people pull the support role with him.
His grabs would kinda be like Blitz's, but you can also fight on your own if you ever get caught, but only if it's a 1v1, or when you start working on items to improve your damage output.
His ultimate's very nice in the way it follows your target; even if they flash away. :D

Diana jungle and Nautilus Supp
You're welcome!

{{champion:9}}  is a champ that works in the jungle as well as support

He's not meta

I wouldn't say he's got mad escape skills, but he can disengage easily with his fear

maybe {{champion:111}}  I've seen him played support

I forgot about Fiddle support!
Fiddle support is really nice if you have a friend as ADC, or the ADC is enthusiastic to the idea of having a non meta support.
Picking Fiddlesticks support is kind of like the Annie support pick.
grossly under rated and capable of carrying?

Yep.
Not a lot of people pick Annie support, and people also underestimate how capable Annie is when she starts climbing in levels, and gets only a couple of AP items.
Fiddlesticks is the same, because people(enemy team) think "what a troll, we're gonna win" and then get curb-stomped because fiddlesticks has many things that can benefit the ADC in the early game, and also his heal lets him stay in lane and hold the lane while the ADC buys items.

{{champion:122}}  jungle especially if you are an earlier pick. People will try to counterpick with something like {{champion:17}} {{champion:133}} and end up getting countered back http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1618658070/202985629

Super juke here with Darius first pick then Shaco second. My own team thought we were trolling :O

http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1617251804/202985629 them thinking Panth jungling. His early level invades do LOTS of damage and can set their jungler back pretty hard

Jungle: rare maybe Karthus, Heimerdinger... and many that have AoE ability...
Support: as long as they have CC and Heal is OK...

And I think I'll go with Galio, as he covers most of everything I need, an I love his story -- it's so cute and bittersweet. Plus, I hear he is getting a bit of a buff recently -- his abilities scaling with MR and AP, giving him an actual passive.

Thanks again for all the advice,

-MF

Also, I am amazed, touched and sort of honored to have gotten so much kind, insightful feedback from you all, Rioters in particular!! Thank you so much. I know this community can be a bit rough sometimes, but it can also be really nice ^_^ So thanks for being that nice side.

Can Vlad support? I know he doesn't really have CC, but he has truly unlimited poke and sustain, as well as invulnerability and some of the best diving ever. He would be a decent choice if anyone has tried him ever.

I play Support jarvan and support rengar, those work well.

Jungle ez is great if you learn how to kite mobs.

Tank support riven is a good one too. She has tons of cc and with her survi +face of the mount she can keep the enemy cc'ed for a while+ do some dmg.

For Jungle, a friend of mine has been doing AD Fizz and having a blast with it. Fizz's passive gives him a ton of survivablity in the jungle, and he's defiantly mobile enough to fit your playstyle.

For Support, you might be able to pull off Urgot. His passive reduces the damage dealt by the other laner, he has an ability that shreds armor (good news for your ADC), he can be tanky, he has a slow, and his ult is a suppress/slow. I've only tried it once, but it seems plausible if you're willing to put in the effort to figure out your build. (We won, but I think I ended up with more kills than my ADC...)
Gangplank support is one of my favourites, especially in certain matchups where he can act as a super aggressive support.

You can try Cho'gath he has lots of CC and pretty good base damages
However if tried to play as support he will probably suffer from mana problems as his abilities/spells are rather expensives and his passive is wasted

You can also go tanky AP mage Cho'Gath support.
I went against an AP Cho once, and it was hell, because he did so much damage early on.

Shaco support is best support.
Try it, they'll never try to facecheck a bush ever again.

Of course, this requires you to have a decent ADC who can engage properly when you're all over the place fearing and slowing everyone. Otherwise you'll get caught out and blown up.
skarner support is annoying as hell for adc with no escape, max his slow and it's free poke for your lane during 2 second
{{champion:31}}  jungle

i would say  rare jungle kartus  in good hand  he is a monster 

for support i would say naut  so much stun

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Mbr8Rcktsu4&list=UU9F1zQlakBV3zBzXypAbtWg
You want Shen jungle.
